segments.text: I see the woman standing in front of the sink, completely absorbed in her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems so focused on polishing that plate, while the water overflows right behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t noticed a single drop spilling over the edge.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s as if the world around her has faded away, replaced by the shine of that dish.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s a certain beauty in her concentration, even as chaos brews beneath her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the puddle is spreading, and I can see the floor is getting slicker.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are behind her, completely oblivious to the danger, too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching for that cookie jar, the stool looks so precarious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it will take before someone slips, and it all goes wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is standing there, anticipating a cookie like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a clash of normalcy outside and chaos inside, and I find that strangely poignant.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden looks so peaceful, contrasting sharply with this ticking time bomb in the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish the woman would take a moment to look around her, to see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But she remains unaware, lost in her own domestic bliss, while trouble brews.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me wonder how often we are blind to the risks lurking right beside us.
segments.speaker: PAR
